state_4_annotation: Unchanged from State 3. No adjudication modifications applied.

wall_street_consensus.source: Yahoo Finance / GuruFocus (pre-Q3 beat estimates updated)
wall_street_consensus.confidence: Medium - estimates likely to be revised post-Q3

near_term_anchors.anchor_reasoning: Management has raised guidance 3x in 2025; consensus trails actual performance. Weighting management guidance > consensus for Y1-Y2.

Revenue_Growth_Rate.description: Long-term sustainable revenue growth for mature consumer fintech
Revenue_Growth_Rate.source: Industry analysis: SoFi, Affirm, LendingClub historical mature growth rates (BASE); RQ4 Growth/TAM analysis confirms industry base rate 10-15% CAGR
Revenue_Growth_Rate.anchor_rationale: Consumer fintech growth converges to GDP+ as penetration matures; TAM growth ~2%. RQ evidence validates BASE assumption with Cash App saturation signal (flat MAUs 4 quarters) confirming market maturity.

EBITDA_Margin.description: Steady-state Adjusted EBITDA margin for scaled consumer fintech
EBITDA_Margin.source: Peer analysis, mature payment/lending company margins (BASE); RQ6 peer benchmarking (Dave 27%, SoFi 26-27%, Cash App 18%, MoneyLion 17%, Chime 15-20%)
EBITDA_Margin.anchor_rationale: Dave's 27% current margin (Q3 2024 GAAP) places at p60-p70 of distribution. BASE terminal 25-30% assumption validated by peer analysis. Structural cost advantages (CAC $19, 4-month payback) support above-median terminal margin.

ROIC_Terminal.description: Terminal ROIC for asset-light fintech with credit exposure
ROIC_Terminal.source: Industry analysis, cost of equity convergence theory (BASE); RQ4, RQ6 confirm industry convergence to 15-25%
ROIC_Terminal.anchor_rationale: High current ROIC (>50%) unsustainable; competitive entry erodes excess returns. BASE terminal 18-22% assumption CONFIRMED by RQ evidence. [State 4: Model produces 40.9% terminal ROIC vs. 18-22% anchor - interpretive guidance recommends 10-15% mental discount]

Credit_Loss_Rate.description: Through-cycle 121-day charge-off rate for subprime-adjacent short-duration credit
Credit_Loss_Rate.source: Historical fintech/subprime credit performance 2015-2023 (BASE); UPDATED with RQ5 unit economics analysis and RQ3b credit crisis precedents
Credit_Loss_Rate.anchor_rationale: UPDATED from BASE: Current 1.6% reflects benign credit; RQ evidence suggests through-cycle normalization to 3.0% (p40-p50) vs. BASE assumption of 2.5% (p10-p20). Industry base rate for subprime-adjacent: 3-6%. Dave benefits from short duration and paycheck linkage but management strategy to 'maximize gross profit dollars' introduces procyclical risk.

MTM_Growth_Rate.source: Neobank/fintech user growth patterns at scale (BASE); RQ4 confirms deceleration trend (21% YoY Q3'24 to 15% YoY Q3'25)
MTM_Growth_Rate.anchor_rationale: Current 15% YoY growth validates BASE start_value. Cash App saturation signal (flat MAUs 4 quarters) supports BASE assumption of fade to 3% terminal. Penetration ceiling approaching as easy acquisition exhausts.
